result.execSummary:
The defendant Rashod L Reliford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed.

Straight Time. Sentence credit of 161 Days were granted.
Concurrent with: Current Sentence

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rashod L Reliford in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant enters guilty plea to count #1, repeater is stricken. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1, repeater stricken. Count #2 is dismissed and read in. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Morin makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. Defendant to be returned forthwith. 

COUNT#1: 

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

___ 9 MONTHS JAIL (CREDIT - 161 days) ***CONCURRENT TO CURRENT SENTENCE***
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $0.00 

COSTS:  $268.00 + $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision on Waukesha County Case # 14CF1042)

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Plea/sentencing hearing on August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morin requests a plea and sentence date.  Court adjourns for plea and sentence. Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
